TopicTitle: To be clear. Asteroids will only appear...

Articles.Content:
... going towards Kerbin?

EDIT for new readers: What I mean, there'll never be asteroids spawning on trajectories with Duna/Jool, or any other planet. I know they won't all always enter Kerbin, but will the only spawn "near" Kerbin?

And if so, what you guys think are the possibilities of mod changing it?

Edited March 25, 2014 by Sokar408

In vicinity of Kerbin, yes. Not necessarily going towards it. During marathon i've seen Spootyman sending a mission to an asteroid close to Kerbin, but there was no encounter - only close fly-by. So not all spawned asteroids cross Kerbin's orbit.
In the Scott Manley interview with developers video, they're doing a mission in the background to an asteroid in an impact trajectory with Kerbin

They will only appear in the area between Kerbin and Duna, I believe. Some will be heading toward Kerbin, some will be going safely past. It is up to you to decide which ones become permanent objects in the Kerbalverse
The asteroids will go into or near kerbin SOI they will not always enter kerbins SOI
I hope to see an asteroid belt full of spawned asteroids and Gilly-sized celestial bodies in future versions near Dres's orbit.

I hope they make it so you can track objects for extended periods and doing so produces an accurate trajectory, once an item has an accurate trajectory it becomes permanent, this would give you plenty of time to establish where they are heading and decide whether to intervene.

I hope they make it so you can track objects for extended periods and doing so produces an accurate trajectory, once an item has an accurate trajectory it becomes permanent, this would give you plenty of time to establish where they are heading and decide whether to intervene.

you just described exactly how it works.

In the tracking station you see question marks.

If you click on them you see it's an asteroid and how big it is.

You do not see its trajectory and they are not permanent.

If you then click "track" you get the trajectory and it becomes permanent. Otherwise the asteroids would disappear over time.
I believe i saw for a short time on one of films displaying sweet new features an asteroid that had orbit from Eve to Jool. Although i may be wrong.
It's always possible the player put it in that orbit.

Since this is the "NASA" spacepack, I think they are trying to bring awareness to the real-life mission plan. And that mission only includes near asteroids. I think in the future KSP will open to asteroids in multiple zones, but for now since they are partnering with NASA for this specific mission, the asteroids will be limited. I think a mod will easily be able to tweak starting locations and starting trajectories. I think long-term KSP goals was to include some large objects out near Eeloo anyway. And at one point Dres was supposed to be a place-holder for an asteroid belt analog in KSP. I think having the asteroids near Kerbin opens up some great gameplay, and I'm glad they decided to go that route to begin with, but I'm sure we'll see more in the future.
